name: disorientating
content:

making someone confused about where they are, where they are going, or what is happening: Moments of disaster are disorientating. The sloping floor has a disorientating effect. See
disorientate
More examplesFewer examplesWe never fly our gliders in cloud because it is too disorientating.Withdrawal from the medication can be very disorientating.Seeing different actors play the same characters is disorientating.She was shaking, unable to cope with the disorientating events of the evening.His art has a disorientating quality.
